intro: Bidens caucalidea, commonly known as the yellow panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas and has slender, branching stems. Its yellow flowers consist of both ray and disk florets, and it produces small, three-lobed seeds. Bidens caucalidea is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
